number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 13, 2016
												after putting over 100 hours into this game, and still going up, i think its safe to say this game is worth 20 bucks! i have logged over 200 hours in Euro Truck Simulator 2, so i have been with this series for a little while. but i have to say, even though there are only 3 trucks, from 2 brands, and 2 states, a 3rd being worked on and going to be added for free, this game somehow is able to keep me hooked. you hear people saying games like farm simulator are "zen games" this game is no different, just put on your music, or stream your favourite radio station, and play this game, is really calming. and i have noticed some people saying its repetitive, and to that i say, no♥♥♥♥♥♥ the whole game, involves you sitting behind a wheel delivering cargo to their destenations, that is all you do, i mean sure you can fill up gas, sleep at rest stops, and... whell thats pretty much it. no getting out of your vehicle... look, if you have played ets2 or have seen any videos on it, you know what to expect. this game is the exact same as euro truck simulator 2, just set in the United States of America, with american trucks. but i am okay with this being the same as ETS 2, they have made a game that i can easily put hundereds of hours into without thinking about it. to put it in perspective, i have 167 games in my library, as of writing this, and the game i put the most time in out of the 167 games is Euro Truck Simulator 2, and American Truck Simulator is quickly climbing the charts, as of the time of writing this review, i have logged 101.4 hours into it, with 12.6 hours in the last 2 weeks and i am still playing it. i dont think this game is for everyone of course, some people cant sit and do the same thing for hundereds of hours, but if you are looking for a good truck simulator, American Truck Simulator is worth it, same goes for Euro Truck Simulator. i am loving this game to bits, and as a matter of fact, next week, i start classes for me to get my CDL A class, thats the Comerical Drivers Licence that allows me to opertate trucks like these, and i have to give thinks to the guys at SCS, between these guys and family i have that are truck drivers, i am going for my dream. but know that this game is not perfect, not terrible, but not perfect, the AI can be sketchy at times, and time compression mixed with traffic can cause problems, but i have never encountered any game breaking bugs.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												This game is very fun & addicting to play. Ya u hear ppl gripe & moan about traffic issues & what not but that's what makes the game challenging to say the least. If one doesn't like the current list of features then i suggest upgrading the game from the stable public release & try out the beta where the new features tend to be. As for cops they have listened to us users & have implimented a 10km/h or 10mph zoning so that as long as ur not 11 clicks or more u won't get penalized by the cops. There is still the odd pita cop like in Las Vegas, LA, Bakersfield, Huron that need tweeking but i'm pretty sure as the game progresses & more states & trucks get added things like that will be refined. This game reminds me of 16yrs ago when the 18 Wheels Of Steel series by SCS started & that was fun. American Truck Simulator is a revival of that old classlic like Haulin' or American Trucker Extreme 1 & 2 or American Long Haul that we all feel in love with. If one loved those then they'll love this sister game to the popular ETS 2. This game is a must have on steam & if it's good now i can't wait till the other 48 states come out & who knows we could even see Canada or Mexico added yrs from now. We could even see it pair up with it's sister game & u can go by ship or plane from American to Europe.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												This is one of the most polished simulators you're likely to ever play. It's largely the same feel of Euro Truck Simulator 2 because it's the same company and game engine. You just get to play in California and Nevada instead of England and France. You also get more American style trucks like Peterbilt. The driving itself feels very realistic and I play with a wired Xbox 360 controller on basic controls (accelerate, brake/reverse, automatic gears). The weather is dynamic so sometimes it will be raining or you'll be driving at night before watching the sunrise. It's a very relaxing game if you want it to be, but I tend to turn on the radio. You can choose from a variety of actual streaming radio stations right inside the game. My favorite is KNAC which is a real life heavy metal station.Outside of driving, most of the game revolves around you buying new trucks and managing a growing business. You will hire employees and gain experience to deliver more dangerous supplies which grant you more money. A piece of advice is I would save up a little money with quick deliveries and then get a loan from the bank to buy your first truck. The game really opens up once you get your own vehicle as it allows for free roaming.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												If you love to drive trucks, this is the the game for you. I drove trucks in real life and this game is a pretty good simulation of it. I played ETS 2 also and the two are so different. Bigger cities, wider roads. The only improvement that American Truck Simulator need is the cops are notorious with fines and need to lower them. The on ramps and off ramps need to be longer for flow of traffic and big trucks. Also the scaling could be longer, more trucks added and of course more mapping. I know it takes a little time for this is understandle. Take your time SCS. I rather have a quality game than a rushed game. Therefore, "I LOVE THIS GAME!!!! HONK ON TRUCKERS!!"

I still prefer Euro Truck Simulator 2, and i believe American Truck Simulator still has a long way to go in terms of expandability both in terms of the map and new American trucks. I wish SCS the best of luck in their future endeavours.

content:
Posted: February 22
												I would reccomend this game, although i find it a bit boring (maybe because i have already played Euro Truck SImulator 2), but it's a really good game. The cities are designed very well, better than the ones in Ets2 in my opinion. The design of everything is on a pretty pretty good level tbh :D (its developed by SCS after all haha). There are only 2 brands of trucks and personally, i dont think thats enough at all but im sure they will add more trucks. The control of the vehicles is on point, the lorrys feel stable and a bit heavy, just like a normal american truck. At first it's hard to steer but as the time gets by you will get used to it. I think it's worth buying if you havent played Ets2 a lot before, but if you are a fan of this type of game i think its worth buying although you've played Ets2 before. The refund will awlays be there for you haha ;). 8.5/10, a great game, not fully developed yet. :)

content:
Posted: February 24, 2016
												At first glance it's easy to dismiss as an ETS2 reskin but when you play it, it feels like so much more and something really special. I came into ETS2 really late, got the huge pack with almost all the DLC included on a big sale and in a short period racked up close to 30 hours and still feel like I've barely scratched the surface. With that being said, I am aware with ATS I am not coming into it with everything already available to me, I'm an early adopter and all the content isn't going to be there yet. So I'm savouring the game in slow play sessions almost like you would sip a fine drink, paying attention to all the detail, and just taking everything in and enjoying it. Are there some things I would change? Absolutely! They've already reduced the fines, but the red light offence is omnipetent and sometimes triggers too easily when you've come to a stop but are slightly over the line. The on ramps are waaay too short and the sparse speed limit signs makes it really easy to get caught in a sudden 55 down to a 30 (I seem to recall a lot more signs you could see from a distance instead of just relying on the GPS speed indicator in ETS2). I don't know about the US but here in Ontario, Canada, our highways have a billion signs for everything.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												Coming from ETS2 I do love the detailed scenery. The cities/towns are larger and more detailed. The scale of the map and time frame is about 1/2 - 3/4 of ETS2, but as the map expands it'll compensate for that. With the included Nevada / Cali maps a typical trip for me lasts about 30 minutes, which is a perfect about of time for me since I prefer shorter routes. There are some bugs on release but I'm sure they will be fixed soon.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												Think of this game as Euro Truck Simulator 2-2.  If you've played ETS2 then you'll find that this is more of the same, but thats definitely not a bad thing.  There are quite a few marked improvements such as multiple drop points, police to keep you driving honestly, weigh stations, larger cities that are less cookie-cutter and have a more natural feel, gas stations in cities, the list can go on.  The graphics are gorgeous and SCS did a good job capturing the American south west.The map currently is pretty small, only consisting of California and Nevada at the time I started playing (Feb 10, 2016) however they plan to release a third state for free and future states as DLC.  However, don't let the size of the map disuade you from taking the leap and enjoying some good ole American trucking.

Not one person has yet taken my interest, even though many beautiful women and handsome gentlemen have all attempted to win my affection. Nothing satisfied me. Not until I played American truck simulator. I first saw the game through various images shared over social media, which made me weak at the knees. "What were these magnificant beasts?". My heart raced at these images, and I grew obsessed with this illusive game. Finally, after months of anticipation and the purchase of a very expensive wheel, the game was released, allowing me to finally get inside the beasts I yearned for. I quickly made a profile, navigating the menus as fast as the game would allow me to, hands shaking in the process. Then, finally, I was inside the magnificant beast. My heart stood still, sweat drooling down my face. I began to drive. Suddenly, I began to violently shake as I began to drive. I began to feel pleasure for the first time in my life as a swooped around the Nevada desert carrying 18t of beans to my awaiting customer. The sudden release of pressure must have overwhelmed me, as I blacked out as I got the truck to hit 80 MPHI woke up 3 hours later, my computer screen covered in sperm. My chair leg was in my♥♥♥♥♥ and my♥♥♥♥♥♥♥was inside my computer, appearing to be so hard it smashed the fans. Best day ever

content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												The first hours into the game, so it is time for a Review. Those who played Euro Truck Simulator 2 will be very familiar with this game from character creation to driving experience. So, what is new?Good:1. Do you remember the exits on two-lane highways, when the right lane was the exit and only the left lane remained as highway? Forget it, they are history. Highways will always have two lanes, so be a nice truck driver and stay on the right lane.2. The fines for causing accidents / speeding / driving without light in tunnels are more harsh than in ETS2. Yes, I actually think that is good, for ETS2 was, at least in my opinion, too lenient.3. Landscape diversity. Surely, it is not the fault of SCS, that Central Europe basically looks the same whereever you go, but it was sometimes a bit boring. But this is America, so there is more than just green grass.4. The cities / towns look a bit less generic and a bit more "natural". Of course Los Angeles is still tiny, but when I drive through a town I now have the feeling that there really might be people living there.Potential Issues (depending on your point of view / expectations):1. One thing ATS did inherit from ETS2 is the traffic AI. And it still is a bit reluctant to simply drive at crossroads instead of waiting whether really really really no car is coming. I think it got a tad bit better, but I may be wrong.2. Trucks. You might have heard, that ATS has only two Trucks so far. And that`s true. SCS is still working on getting licenses for more trucks.3. Map size. Right now there is California and Nevada. These two states are roughly the same size as Germany and Poland combined, but compared to ETS2 the map in ATS is smaller, so you can cover more distance in the same time. The longest distance possible so far should be from the northern to the southern edge of California and you will probably find, that this is not the "Long Haul" feeling yet. A third state, Arizona, will come for free soon and, according to rumors, New Mexico and Texas (probably as DLC) are next in the pipeline. If this is true, driving times will increase a lot in the future, since the US of A are huge.For me, personally, the last two things are not crucial or game-breaking or even negatively impacting my game experience. But don`t say, I did not warn you. :)All in all I am really pleased with what I have got for 20 bucks and am looking forward to future developments.Greetings

content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												I had been looking forward to this game for some time now. Once it finally arrived, it did not disappoint. There still isn't anywhere near as much content as Euro Truck Simulator 2, but I imagine that will be fixed fairly soon. Overall, this is a good game.There are a few tiny details that bug me, however, namely in vehicle lighting. This is understandable for a european company though, as we do things differently here in the US. Here's a short list:-Trailers are missing clearance lights (the three amber/red lights at the top, or as high as practical)-On AI vehicles that have them, the clearance lights in the rear should be red (they are amber)-On AI vehicles, the side marker lights should be red in the back. The amber side markers are for the front only.Overall, this is an amazing game, with some beautiful scenery and plenty of detail. I look forward to seeing what future content is added.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												I've played Euro Truck Simulator 2 for a while now, and when its American cousin was announced, I wondered what it could offer to me that I couldn't already get in ETS2. Aside from some largely cosmetic changes, what new experiences would make this game worth playing? I wasn't going to buy it; I didn't see much appeal in starting over and working my way back through the grades to unlock more stuff. But I did buy it, on a whim, on release day. And I found that, though fundamentally similar (of course), it was evocatively different to ETS2. It has let me experience something that I hadn't found in ETS2. I find the gameplay slower, more relaxed, the world more open somehow. The prospect of bigger, longer drives once more states are opened up is enticing, more so than further expansions to the boundaries of ETS2.It's still early days, but I don't regret that whim.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												This is probably one of the best games I've played. Let me make the list.Pros:Realism - Like some others have stated you will bring stuff to where it actually goes, like construction equipment will go to construction site, etc.More Realism - Now I know some people say the AI is broken, but when I play it works really well. They slow down and even stop when your merging onto a highway, they will let you take your turn at a stop sign, as long as you use your turn signals then the AI works great, and much more!Even more Realism - Working mirrors (that you can adjust so you can see out of them better), looking out your window, when it rains you can turn on your wipers and if you don't then you can't see as well out your window, while driving you need fuel, you can get tired (I don't know yet on what happens when your tired haven't had a 24 hour drive yet), traffic offenses (they don't go full on all the laws in the us I don't think because then it would be a little to hard to start), when your in the county you can see crop dusters actually dusting their crops, and lots more.Mod Support - When a game adds mod support it allows the community to really get into the game because they can make content for it for other to use and make their experience more enjoyable. Like say you want a feature in the game but isn't in the game yet/won't be in the game, you can use a mod someone made and have that feature. They even help by letting you know when a mod is incompatible so you don't go searching for hours with tons of mods installed for the mod that breaks your game.Trucking - It's as the title and description say, you're a truck driver. (Idk if this is a spoiler but I'll assume it is) You start off with no money but your a driver for hire, earn enough money to buy your own truck and be your own boss. (Or get a bank loan and buy a truck. :P) I got most of the DLC when I bough the game as most of it is free. (Unless somehow Nevada isn't in yet and I have it for some reason. :P) If you think the drive times will be realistic because the game is very realistic then don't worry, they don't want you to spend 20 hours on one delivery. It goes much faster.And Lots Lots More!Cons:The only con for me is turning needs a tiny bit of work, like I'm use to the wheel auto-correcting when I let got of the turning button but I guess it's more realistic that you have to turn the other way to stop turning.My Opinion of the Game: A must buy if you like a nice relaxing game. Just you and the open road. But is still very fun. And I'll let y'all in on a funny place to sit online, if you go to Oxnard, the GPS takes you a route that most people at one point have no idea how to drive on so there is just a 50 truck pile up. And sometimes someone will be going 100 miles an hour and fly off the cliff. Lol. Definitely recommend this game. Fun times.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												Think of this game as Euro Truck Simulator 2-2.  If you've played ETS2 then you'll find that this is more of the same, but thats definitely not a bad thing.  There are quite a few marked improvements such as multiple drop points, police to keep you driving honestly, weigh stations, larger cities that are less cookie-cutter and have a more natural feel, gas stations in cities, the list can go on.  The graphics are gorgeous and SCS did a good job capturing the American south west.The map currently is pretty small, only consisting of California and Nevada at the time I started playing (Feb 10, 2016) however they plan to release a third state for free and future states as DLC.  However, don't let the size of the map disuade you from taking the leap and enjoying some good ole American trucking.

Posted: February 6, 2016
												American Truck Simulator.I wasn't really hyped about this game, I thought it would be on my wish list and play a few hours and then go back to ETS 2, but I was wrong. This game just feels different and feels more alive and dynamic compared to ETS 2. Allot of people argue to say that it is the same or just added DLC but for the price of £14.99 for me in the UK. Why grumble! It just feels better and smootherAlthough the there are not many trucks SCS have told us why as the link between consumer and developer is spot on so we always know whats happening with the gameSCS are also a great developer as they knew we were excited so they released it earlier for us! A lot of games companies would never do that! Overall the game is a 7/10 and when more trucks and more map has been added this will easily be a 10/10 for me!

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												American Truck Simulator is a game where you get into a truck and drive across the United States (just a bit of the South West and California for now unless you get map mods). It may not sound fun but it is because you can go to real places that you may not be able to see in the real world, there are a lot of goals such as;- Get your own truck- Pay off a loan- Fully upgrade a garage- Travel to every cityand so on. Someone commented here on Steam that it gets boring when you complete those ones but you can make more goals like be a major carrier with 1,000+ trucks and having all of your garages fully upgraded. Some cons are;- Steering wheel and brakes are too sensitive- You cannot own trailers- You cannot put your company logo and/or name on the trucks- You cannot put a truck number on the truck which is more realistic when you have a fleet- There are no beacons for the trucks at first but you can get mods- Almost nothing in the cab to customize- Road signs do not reflect light when they are in the distance which does happen in real life- Low beams do not have a large enough beam at night- No walking mode (however that would be the same as GTAV with it's trucking mods)However, some great things are;- Having realistic hazardous placards but they are missing the UN number for the hazmat loads- The parking brake makes a sound when applied or released- Unlike SCS's 18 Wheels Of Steel series ATS supports MP3 format audio which is more common it seams- You can listen to real radio station's online player through the game- Customizable licence plates if you have a World Of Trucks account- Varied delivery points and skilled backingSomethings I would want to be added is;- Overtime the truck gets dirty epically from driving in the desert and construction sites so you should go to a truck stop for a wash (if your truck is dirty then you are more likely to get inspected at the scales in real life), also the air filters needing to be changed once and a while. Plus, being able to spray your windshield with washer fluid and that running out over time- Emergency vehicles going to a call sometimes, occasional AI traffic crashes and other emergency calls and seeing the vehicles on the side of the road. - Building and road construction will progress slightly each time you revisit the area (more if it has been a while). Eventually it is done and some very old buildings get demolished then a new one is built.- Having a choice of Km/h or MPH on the outside of the speedometer- Hitchhikers and have some of them reference films, shows, songs or something. However, to talk to them then SCS would need to get several voice actors so the player can choose a voice for their character so the character can talk to them.- Several fictional game stations for different areas that will comment on the weather, traffic in that station's area and turn to static and eventually another station if the player drives far enough.Overall, I give this game 8.5/10

Posted: April 3, 2016
												Hi, my name is Dave "Butter My Biscuit" Johnson. Let me begin by saying that I've been behind the wheel of a Kensworth since I was a pup. My father would sit me on his lap and teach me the basics of being a man (How to drive a Kenny, how to cook bratwurst steak wrap, how to pollinate one of them there females, etc). I hurt my leg in a backyard gator wrastlin' party I had with my wife and 34 kids. I can be a bit of a show-off around the younguns. I was unable to lift my heavy, meat vitamin enriched belly into my Kensworth Dubya 900 Daycab. :( .I decided to pick up this beautiful sum birch of a game. Needless to say, I could not be more happy with that there purchase. I'll tell ya what, playing this game gives me a real semi! HAW HAW. I'm able to get out of the house and avoid the wifey while blastin' some Toby Keith on the open road. I'd recommend this game to any man who wants to put a few inches on the ol' peckerwood. You're sure to have a blast.I'd give this game a solid 9 YEEHAWS out of 10 possible YEEHAWS. That's 90 percent out of a 100, or 900 of 1,000 for those who like big numbers.

content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
												As for those who have played Euro Truck Simulator 2, you will find this game to be very much similar. Truthfully, the only really noticeable differences would have to be the landscape(s), traffic, trucks, e.t.c. The performance and everything is slightly better, (in my case), and it was excellent to begin with in ETS2. I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoyed the ETS series, and for anyone thinking of trying out the series for the first time.As for the newcomers, keep in mind this is not a game designed for freeroaming, constantly popping in and out of any vehicle you want, or for professionally managing a business; it's a truck driving sim. You drive trucks under an employer until you make enough money to buy your own truck. From there on you haul various types of cargo to build your wealth. You then move on to expand your garage(s), buy more trucks, hire drivers, and make money. From a broad standpoint, yes it does simulate business, but that's not the primary goal of the game; it's for driving trucks.Summary summed up: if you want to drive anything you please any time or manage a business from a professional standpoint, this game is not what you're hunting. If you want to drive a semi, (and make money doing so), haul lots of different things, and design trucks for your employees to drive, this is what you want.
